timeline.bodyText:
We could also use the new less granular/more human errors for form download as well, but we'd need to discuss how that works. Collect is currently really verbose and outputs the failure/success status for each form so it's not as simple as just switching out the text.
I think writing up an issue/feature for how errors should look on Get Blank Form would be ideal.
timeline.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: We don't care about Result.failure() as the only thing it does is give let us inspect failure counts in following work which we're not doing.
timeline.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: I think there are still a few strings in both the auto send and auto download flows that may end up not translated. This is an existing issue however, so I didn't want to dedicate too much time to restructuring everything to fix it. I reckon we just create an issue for this?
timeline.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: fetchForm and fetchMediaFile happen to have the same implementation but it felt keeping the separate was the right thing to do™️ as the call sites don't really know or care that they involve the same work.
timeline.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: I had a good go at chipping away at this but there is far more to be done. I think we need to get to a point where we're not calling this anywhere but ServerFormDownloader to really start tearing it apart. There is a lot of logic around task cancellation in here that needs to get the hell out.
timeline.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: This is just showing the same refresh button in the error color right now. I think ultimately we want a "badge" but if everyone can live with this initially it'll save time faffing around with the new beta badging API (or in creating a new icon).
timeline.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: I killed all the error messages coming out of here and pretty much all the error logging. Most of it isn't needed to show the errors we're trying to show. Good to check and see if any of it feels like something we'd need to keep.
